elements.description:
Px-product-switcher is a navigation component for switching between products or applications, a level above the standard px-app-nav for navigation within an application. ### Usage
Content for the top of the list
Content for the bottom of the list

properties.name: items
properties.description:
An array that contains the list of items which show up in the switcher.
Each item is an object consisting of:
* 'key' - a unique identifier (number or string)
* 'val' - the actual text that is displayed
* 'icon' - an icon name from the px-icon-set to display next to the item (optional)

properties.name: opened
properties.description: A flag which reflects if the product switcher trigger has been clicked or not.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
Horizontal alignment of the dropdown relative to the trigger.
Should be one of `left` or `right` where `left` means that the dropdown
and trigger are aligned on their left side, so the dropdown will extend _to the right_.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
Vertical alignment of the dropdown relative to the trigger.
Should be one of `top` or `bottom` where `top` means that the dropdown
and trigger are aligned at the top, so the dropdown will extend _below_ the trigger.

properties.name: mobile
properties.description:
Whether the product switcher should display in a mobile configuration.
Automatically calculated based on the breakpoint in `mobileAt`.

properties.name: mobileAt
properties.description: Value (in pixels) at which to switch to the mobile configuration.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Icon to be used as the invoking trigger element for the product switcher.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Key of the item selected in the product switcher.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Opens the switcher when the trigger is pressed.

methods.name: _getClass
methods.description: Calculates class to use for product switcher.

methods.name: _handleSelection
methods.description:
Handles the selection from px-dropdown.
Fires an event and closes the dropdown.
